desserts.name: Apple Pie
desserts.description: An apple pie is a pie in which the principal filling ingredient is apple, originated in England. It is often served with whipped cream, ice cream, or cheddar cheese.

desserts.name: Pecan Pie
desserts.description: Pecans, corn syrup (or brown sugar, or both); considered a southern dish, but you’ll find it anywhere you find pies; especially popular as a dessert during Thanksgiving or Christmas; the pumpkin pie is its heated rival.

desserts.name: Custard Pie
desserts.description: A custard pie is any type of uncooked custard mixture added to an uncooked or partially cooked crust and baked together.

desserts.name: Key Lime Pie
desserts.description: Lime juice (specifically one from a Key lime), meringue topping, and graham-cracker crust; naturally, the pie is heavily associate with the Florida Keys, and Key West holds a festival for the pie every 4th of July Weekend.

desserts.name: Cheesecake
desserts.description: First off—yes, this is a pie, since it uses a graham-cracker crust that’s synonymous with pies. The other main ingredient is cream cheese or ricotta, which can be combined with myriad other flavors

desserts.name: Muffin
desserts.description: A muffin is an individual-sized, baked product. It can refer to two distinct items, a part-raised flatbread that is baked and then cooked on a griddle and a cupcake-like quickbread that is chemically leavened and then baked in a mold.

desserts.name: Strawberry Danish
desserts.description: A Danish pastry, sometimes shortened to just Danish, is a multilayered, laminated sweet pastry in the viennoiserie tradition. The concept was brought to Denmark by Austrian bakers, and has since developed into a Danish specialty.

desserts.name: Banana Bread
desserts.description: Banana bread is a type of bread made from mashed bananas. It is often a moist, sweet, cake-like quick bread; however there are some banana bread recipes that are traditional-style raised breads.

desserts.name: Beignet
desserts.description: Beignet, is a type of fritter, or deep-fried pastry, typically made from pâte à choux, but may also be made from other types of dough, including yeast dough.

desserts.name: Doughnuts
desserts.description: A doughnut or donut is a type of fried dough confection or dessert food. It is popular in many countries and is prepared in various forms as a sweet snack that can be homemade or purchased in bakeries, supermarkets, food stalls, and franchised specialty vendors.

desserts.name: Ice Cream
desserts.description: Ice-cream is a sweetened frozen food typically eaten as a snack or dessert. It is usually made from dairy products, such as milk and cream, and often combined with fruits or other ingredients and flavors.

desserts.name: Choco Gelato
desserts.description: Gelato is a frozen dessert popular in Italy. It is generally a mixture of custard, cream, and milk, without eggs.

desserts.name: Strawberry Sherbet
desserts.description: Sherbet or Sherbert a frozen fruit and dairy product that contains anywhere from 1 percent to 2 percent milkfat from milk or cream.

desserts.name: Frozen Yogurt
desserts.description: Frozen yogurt is made without any cream. Instead bacteria cultures are added to an ice cream base to emulsify the dairy solution.

desserts.name: Kulfi
desserts.description: Kulfi has similarities to ice cream in appearance and taste; however it is denser and creamier.It comes in various flavours.

desserts.name: Chocolate Ganache
desserts.description: Finely chopped chocolate and hot cream are thoroughly blended to make the simplest form of the world-famous sweet creation called ganache.

desserts.name: Jelly Beans
desserts.description: These tiny, bean-shaped sugar candies are an indelible part of the childhood memories of millions of Americans.

desserts.name: Cajeta
desserts.description: Cajeta is a sweet Mexican confectionery product that is most often made from caramelized goat's milk.

desserts.name: Chocolate Truffiles
desserts.description: Chocolate truffles are made with ganache that's shaped into a ball, dipped in chocolate, and rolled in cocoa powder.

desserts.name: Ahlgrens Bilar
desserts.description: Ahlgrens is a Swedish confectionery company which is most known by its Ahlgrens bilar (Ahlgren's cars), a fruit-flavored marshmallow that is extremely popular with most Swedes.

desserts.name: Vlokken
desserts.description: Vlokken is a popular Dutch confectionery product made from regular, dark, or white chocolate.

desserts.name: Bajadera
desserts.description: Bajadera is a traditional Croatian nougat praline that's commercially produced by Kraš since 1954.

desserts.name: Maple Butter
desserts.description: Maple butter is a traditional Canadian confection made from maple syrup that's heated, cooled, and whipped until it develops a smooth consistency.

desserts.name: Panna Cotta
desserts.description: Gelatin turns liquids into gels and helps maintain the airy nature of whipped creams, mousses, and foams. Unleash its delightful properties with our collection of gorgeous gelatin desserts.

desserts.name: Marshmallows
desserts.description: Kids will love helping you make these fluffy confections, and adding cocoa and two types of chocolate chips just increases the excitement.

desserts.name: Terrine
desserts.description: A terrine is a classic French dish where ingredients are pressed together in a baking dish or sheet.

desserts.name: Jelly Shots
desserts.description: A gelatin shot is a shooter in which one or more liquors, usually vodka, rum, tequila, or neutral grain spirit, replaces some of the water or fruit juice that is used to congeal the gel.

desserts.name: Butter Cakes
desserts.description: Any recipe for cake that begins 'cream butter and sugar' is a butter cake. After the creaming, you add eggs to aerate the batter a bit, flour (and sometimes another liquid, like milk) to give it structure and texture, and baking powder or baking soda to ensure that it rises in the oven.

desserts.name: Pound Cake
desserts.description: It's so called because it can be measured as a matter of proportion: a pound of butter, a pound of sugar, a pound of eggs, and a pound of flour. In some pound cake recipes, you'll see the eggs separated and the egg whites whipped and folded into the batter, to leaven it; in other recipes you'll find leaveners like baking soda and baking powder, bringing it well into the butter-cake fold.

desserts.name: Sponge Cake
desserts.description: Any recipe that contains no baking soda or baking powder but lots of whipped eggs or egg whites? That's a sponge cake and there are several different types of sponge cake. which will be called different things wherever you are.

desserts.name: Genoise Cake
desserts.description: In genoise, whole eggs are beaten with sugar until they're thick and ribbony, and then flour (and sometimes butter) is added and the batter is baked; the result is wonderful baked in a round cake pan and simply frosted, but genoise is also pliable enough to be baked in a jelly-roll pan and rolled up into a roulade.

desserts.name: Biscuit
desserts.description: Biscuit (always pronounced the French way as bees-kwee) cakes are another type of sponge cake containing both egg whites and yolks, but, unlike genoise, the whites and yolks are whipped separately and then folded back together.

desserts.name: Angel Food Cake
desserts.description: Angel food cakes are made with egg whites alone and no yolks. The whites are whipped with sugar until very firm before the flour is gently folded in, resulting in a snowy-white, airy, and delicate cake that marries beautifully with fruit.

categories.name: Frozen Desserts
categories.description: Ice cream, gelato, sorbet and shaved-ice desserts fit into this category. Ice cream is a cream base that is churned as it is frozen to create a creamy consistency.

categories.name: Pies
categories.description: Pies and cobblers are a crust with a filling. The crust can be either made from either a pastry or crumbs. Pie fillings range from fruits to puddings; cobbler fillings are generally fruit-based.

categories.name: Pastries
categories.description: Pastries are sweet baked pastry products. Pastries can either take the form of light and flaky bread with an airy texture, such as a croissant or unleavened dough with a high fat content and crispy texture, such as shortbread.

categories.name: Confectionaries
categories.description: Confection, also called candy, sweets or lollies, features sugar or honey as a principal ingredient. Many involve sugar heated into crystals with subtle differences. Dairy and sugar based include caramel, fudge and toffee or taffy.

categories.name: Gelatinous Desserts
categories.description: Jellied desserts are made with a sweetened liquid thickened with gelatin or another thickening agent. They are traditional in many cultures.

categories.name: Cakes
categories.description: Cakes are sweet tender breads made with sugar and delicate flour. Cakes can vary from light, airy sponge cakes to dense cakes with less flour.
